intro: Steganthera ledermannii, commonly known as the Ledermann's burr, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Leguminosae, also known as the Fabaceae family, which includes many legumes. The plant produces distinctive, spiny pods that enclose its seeds, a feature typical of many members of this family. It is often found in sandy or rocky soils and thrives in arid or semi-arid environments. The species is noted for its ability to fix nitrogen, which helps improve soil fertility.
